content: I do not have access to very recent news or data. however, according to reports in previous years, weather patterns in central america have impacted the production of coffee beans. in particular, droughts, floods, and unusually high temperatures have affected coffee crops, reducing yields and affecting the quality of the beans. in addition, the spread of coffee rust, a fungal disease that attacks coffee trees, has also affected crops in the region. these weather patterns have led to significant economic losses for coffee farmers and have had broader impacts on the coffee industry and economies of countries in central america.
